SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.jaunt.component
Class Form

java.lang.Object
  com.jaunt.component.Form

public class Form
extends java.lang.Object

A class representing a HTML/XHTML form, with methods for finding, retrieving, and setting form fields of various types (eg textfields, dropdown menus, checkboxes, hidden fields, etc), as well as methods for submitting the form and generating request permuations.

Since:
0.9.0
Author:
Tom Cervenka

          The form element that begins the form.

 Element getElement()
          Returns the form Element for this Form.
 short getEnctype()
          Retrieves the enctype of the form, or the default enctype if no enctype is specified in the form
 short getMethod()
          Retrieves the method of the current form, denoted by the method constants in HttpRequest, or if no method was specified in the form, returns the default HttpRequest.GET
 HttpRequest getRequest()
          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission without pressing any particular submit button, or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
 HttpRequest getRequest(java.util.regex.Pattern submitLabelPattern)
          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression Pattern (using Matcher.matches), or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
 HttpRequest getRequest(java.lang.String submitButtonRegex)
          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression (using Matcher.matches), or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
 java.util.List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations()
          Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.
 java.util.List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations(java.lang.String submitLabelRegex)
          Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.
 Form select(java.lang.String label, java.lang.String optionRegex)
          Completes the dropdown menu or menu list (ie select component) that has the specified text label (case insensitive, space insensitive) with the option(s) that matches (using Matcher.matches) the specified (case insensitive) regular expression.
 Form set(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the form input with the specified name to the specified value; FileComponents are set to upload the file who's location is specified by the specified value; Checkboxes are 'checked' if the specified value is the same (case insensitive) as the value attribute of the checkbox (or is "on" if no value attribute is specified).
 void setAction(java.lang.String action)
          Sets the action attribute of the form to the specified url.
 Form setCheckBox(java.lang.String name, boolean checked)
          Sets whether the first checkbox with the specified (case-insensitive) name is checked and throws an Exception if the checkbox was not found.
 void setEnctype(short enctype)
          Sets the enctype of the form to the specified enctype (constant of HttpRequest).
 Form setFile(java.lang.String name, java.io.File file)
          Sets the first FileComponent with the specified (case insensitive) name to upload the specified File and throws an Exception if no FileComponent with specified name was found.
 Form setHidden(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the first hidden field with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name exists.
 void setMethod(short method)
          Sets the method (GET or POST) to the specified method constant in HttpRequest.
 Form setPassword(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the first password field with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name exists.
 Form setRadio(java.lang.String name, int n)
          Sets the radiobutton at index n and with the specified name to be 'checked' and deselects all onther radiobuttons with the same name, throwing an exception if no such radiobutton exists.
 Form setRadio(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the radiobutton with the specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'checked' and deselects all other radiobuttons with the same name.
 Form setSelect(java.lang.String name, int n)
          Sets the nth menu option with the specified (case insensitive) name to 'selected', and deselects all other options in the same select tag, throwing an Exception if no such menu option was found.
 Form setSelect(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the first menu option with specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'selected' and deselects all other options in the same select tag if the select tag does not have 'multiple' keyword; throws an Exception if no such menu option exists.
 Form setTextArea(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the textarea with specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no such button exists.
 Form setTextField(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the first textfield with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name was found.
 Document submit()
          Submits the the form without pressing any particular submit button; no name-value pair contribution from any submit button is added to the query string.
 Document submit(int submitButtonIndex)
          Submits the the form by pressing the submit button specified by its index, with indexing starting at 0, and throws an Exception if specified submitButton is not found.
 Document submit(java.lang.String valueRx)
          Submits the the form by pressing the submit button who's value (ie, text label) matches (case-insensitive) the specified regular expression (using Matcher.matches) and throws an Exception if the specified submitButton does not exist (or more than one matches the regex).
 Form unchoose(short labelOrientation, java.lang.String label)
          Unselects the radiobutton or checkbox with the specified label.

Method Detail

getElement

public Element getElement()
Returns the form Element for this Form.

setMethod

public void setMethod(short method)
Sets the method (GET or POST) to the specified method constant in HttpRequest.

Parameters:
method - the request method (eg, HttpRequest.TYPE_GET, HttpRequest.TYPE_POST)

getMethod

public short getMethod()
Retrieves the method of the current form, denoted by the method constants in HttpRequest, or if no method was specified in the form, returns the default HttpRequest.GET

Returns:
either HttpRequest.TYPE_GET or HttpRequest.TYPE_POST.

setAction

public void setAction(java.lang.String action)
Sets the action attribute of the form to the specified url.

Parameters:
action - a fully qualified url.

getAction

public java.lang.String getAction()
Retrieves the action attribute of the form.

Returns:
the action attribute value or if no action attribute exists, returns url of the document (sans querystring), or null if the document was not retrieved via url.

setEnctype

public void setEnctype(short enctype)
Sets the enctype of the form to the specified enctype (constant of HttpRequest).

getEnctype

public short getEnctype()
Retrieves the enctype of the form, or the default enctype if no enctype is specified in the form

Returns:
an enctype (constant of HttpRequest).

set

public Form set(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String value)
         throws NotFound
Sets the form input with the specified name to the specified value; FileComponents are set to upload the file who's location is specified by the specified value; Checkboxes are 'checked' if the specified value is the same (case insensitive) as the value attribute of the checkbox (or is "on" if no value attribute is specified). In order to uncheck a checked checkbox, the value parameter should be null.

Throws:
NotFound

setFile

public Form setFile(java.lang.String name,
                    java.io.File file)
             throws NotFound
Sets the first FileComponent with the specified (case insensitive) name to upload the specified File and throws an Exception if no FileComponent with specified name was found.

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

setTextField

public Form setTextField(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String value)
                  throws NotFound
Sets the first textfield with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name was found.

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

                 throws NotFound

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.

NotFound

               throws NotFound

setCheckBox

public Form setCheckBox(java.lang.String name,
                        boolean checked)
                 throws NotFound
Sets whether the first checkbox with the specified (case-insensitive) name is checked and throws an Exception if the checkbox was not found.

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

setRadio

public Form setRadio(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String value)
              throws NotFound
Sets the radiobutton with the specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'checked' and deselects all other radiobuttons with the same name.

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

setRadio

public Form setRadio(java.lang.String name,
                     int n)
              throws NotFound
Sets the radiobutton at index n and with the specified name to be 'checked' and deselects all onther radiobuttons with the same name, throwing an exception if no such radiobutton exists.

Parameters:
name - the case insensitive name.
n - index of the radiobutton, with indexing starting at 0.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

setTextArea

public Form setTextArea(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String value)
                 throws NotFound
Sets the textarea with specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no such button exists.

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

setSelect

public Form setSelect(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String value)
               throws NotFound
Sets the first menu option with specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'selected' and deselects all other options in the same select tag if the select tag does not have 'multiple' keyword; throws an Exception if no such menu option exists.

Returns:
the index of the option that was selected, with indexing starting at 0.
Throws:
NotFound

setSelect

public Form setSelect(java.lang.String name,
                      int n)
               throws NotFound
Sets the nth menu option with the specified (case insensitive) name to 'selected', and deselects all other options in the same select tag, throwing an Exception if no such menu option was found.

Parameters:
name - the (case insensitive) name,
n - index of the menu option, with indexing starting at 0.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

select

public Form select(java.lang.String label,
                   java.lang.String optionRegex)
            throws NotFound,
                   MultipleFound
Completes the dropdown menu or menu list (ie select component) that has the specified text label (case insensitive, space insensitive) with the option(s) that matches (using Matcher.matches) the specified (case insensitive) regular expression.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive, left-side label.
optionRegex - case-insensitive regular expresion to match the text of one or more options.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

fillout

public Form fillout(java.lang.String label,
                    java.lang.String text)
             throws NotFound,
                    MultipleFound
Fills the textfield, password field, or textarea field that has the specified text label with the specified value.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive, left-side label.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

choose

public Form choose(short labelOrientation,
                   java.lang.String label)
            throws NotFound,
                   MultipleFound
Selects the radiobutton or checkbox with the specified label.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive label of the radiobutton or checkbox.
labelOrientation - Text orientation constant indicating the position of the label with respect to the radiobutton or checkbox.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

unchoose

public Form unchoose(short labelOrientation,
                     java.lang.String label)
              throws NotFound,
                     MultipleFound
Unselects the radiobutton or checkbox with the specified label.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive label of the radiobutton or checkbox.
labelOrientation - Text orientation constant indicating the position of the label with respect to the radiobutton or checkbox.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

submit

public Document submit()
                throws ResponseException
Submits the the form without pressing any particular submit button; no name-value pair contribution from any submit button is added to the query string.

Returns:
Document or null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
Throws:
ResponseException

submit

public Document submit(int submitButtonIndex)
                throws NotFound,
                       ResponseException
Submits the the form by pressing the submit button specified by its index, with indexing starting at 0, and throws an Exception if specified submitButton is not found.

Returns:
Document or null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
Throws:
NotFound
ResponseException

submit

public Document submit(java.lang.String valueRx)
                throws SearchException,
                       ResponseException
Submits the the form by pressing the submit button who's value (ie, text label) matches (case-insensitive) the specified regular expression (using Matcher.matches) and throws an Exception if the specified submitButton does not exist (or more than one matches the regex).

Returns:
Document or null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
Throws:
SearchException
ResponseException

getRequest

public HttpRequest getRequest()
Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission without pressing any particular submit button, or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.

getRequest

public HttpRequest getRequest(java.lang.String submitButtonRegex)
                       throws NotFound,
                              MultipleFound
Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression (using Matcher.matches), or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.

Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

getRequest

public HttpRequest getRequest(java.util.regex.Pattern submitLabelPattern)
                       throws NotFound,
                              MultipleFound
Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression Pattern (using Matcher.matches), or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.

Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

addPermutationTarget

public void addPermutationTarget(java.lang.String name)
Tags the form component with the specified name (ie the value of its name attribute) as a permutation target.

See Also:
getRequestPermutations(), getRequestPermutations(String)

addPermutationTarget

public void addPermutationTarget(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.Object[] values)
Tags the form component with the specified name (ie the value of its name attribute) as a permutation target.

Parameters:
values - an array of values through which the tagged component should be varied to generate the request variations (this parameter should be null if the values are already contained within the component).
See Also:
getRequestPermutations(), getRequestPermutations(String)

clearPermutationTargets

public void clearPermutationTargets()
Un-tags all elements tagged for permutation.

getRequestPermutations

public java.util.List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations()
Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.

See Also:
addPermutationTarget(String, Object[])

getRequestPermutations

public java.util.List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations(java.lang.String submitLabelRegex)
                                                   throws NotFound,
                                                          MultipleFound
Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.

Parameters:
submitLabelRegex - regular expression used for (case insensitive) matching the label of the submit button (using Matcher.matches) to contribute name-value pairs to each permutation.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound
See Also:
addPermutationTarget(String, Object[])
